** [[CRUX#CRUX PPC|Crux PPC]]
** [[CRUX#CRUX PPC|Crux PPC]]
** [[Debian]], with 32-bit ''powerpc'' a released port<ref>[http://www.debian.org/ports/powerpc/ Debian - PowerPC Port<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>, and ''[[ppc64]]'' in development<ref>[http://debian-ppc64.alioth.debian.org/ Debian PPC64 Port<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>. Due to the considerations above the developers recommend using the 32-bit "powerpc" port on 64-bit systems (with an appropriate 64-bit kernel).
** [[Debian]], with 32-bit ''powerpc'' a released port<ref>[http://www.debian.org/ports/powerpc/ Debian - PowerPC Port<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>, and ''[[ppc64]]'' in development<ref>[http://debian-ppc64.alioth.debian.org/ Debian PPC64 Port<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>. Due to the considerations above the developers recommend using the 32-bit "powerpc" port on 64-bit systems (with an appropriate 64-bit kernel).
â
**[[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] with 32 bit ppc releases <ref>[http://fedoraproject.org/get-fedora Fedora Project<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
+
**[[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]] with 32 bit ppc releases <ref>[http://fedoraproject.org/get-fedora Fedora Project<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
** [[Gentoo Linux]], with 32-bit ''ppc'' releases<ref>[http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/base/ppc/ Gentoo Linux Projects - Gentoo Linux PowerPC Development<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and an obsolete 64-bit ''[[ppc64]]'' release. Due to the considerations above the developers recommend using the 32-bit "ppc" release on 64-bit systems (with an appropriate 64-bit kernel).
** [[Gentoo Linux]], with 32-bit ''ppc'' releases<ref>[http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/base/ppc/ Gentoo Linux Projects - Gentoo Linux PowerPC Development<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and an obsolete 64-bit ''[[ppc64]]'' release. Due to the considerations above the developers recommend using the 32-bit "ppc" release on 64-bit systems (with an appropriate 64-bit kernel).
** [[OpenSUSE]], Full support for Old World and New World PowerMacs(32 & 64bit), PS3/Cell, and IBM POWER systems.
** [[OpenSUSE]], Full support for Old World and New World PowerMacs(32 & 64bit), PS3/Cell, and IBM POWER systems.
